intro: Agrostophyllum parviflorum, commonly known as the small-flowered agrostophyllum, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its compact growth habit and narrow leaves. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences with tiny, white or pale green flowers. It is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
